poem:
### A Quiet Morning

In a world of steel and stone,  
the whispered echoes  
of a life extinguished—  
bars heavy with secrets.  
Ashes of a songbird,  
melodies lost in shadow,  
where the heart turns cold  
and silence speaks truth.  
Time finds its measure,  
among the stillness  
of unforgiving walls.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two more men arrested over death of Lostprophets singer Ian Watkins Two more men have been arrested in connection with the death of the former Lostprophets frontman, Ian Watkins, at HMP Wakefield, West Yorkshire police said. Watkins, 48, who was serving a 29-year sentence with a further six years to be served on licence after admitting a string of offences including the attempted rape of a baby, died after being assaulted in the high-security jail". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Two more men arrested over death of Lostprophets singer Ian Watkins Two more men have been arrested in connection with the death of the former Lostprophets frontman, Ian Watkins, at HMP Wakefield, West Yorkshire police said. Watkins, 48, who was serving a 29-year sentence with a further six years to be served on licence after admitting a string of offences including the attempted rape of a baby, died after being assaulted in the high-security jail
